questions.question: What is the overall shape of the presented nutritional information panel, considering its borders and layout?
What is the predominant color used for the text within the nutritional facts panel?
What is the background color of the nutritional facts panel itself?
What is the primary font style used for displaying the nutritional information, based on its visual characteristics?
Considering the text's arrangement, what is the visual organizational structure used to present the nutritional values?
What is the font weight (boldness) of the header 'Nutrition Facts' at the top of the panel?
What is the text formatting for the individual nutrient labels (e.g., 'Total Fat', 'Sodium') within the panel?
What is the font size of the main nutritional values (e.g., '0g', '70mg') relative to the nutrient labels?
What visual element or character separates the nutrient labels from their corresponding values?
Are there any visual elements like lines or borders separating different sections of the nutritional information?
What is the overall visual density of the information presented within the panel? High, medium, or low?
What is the visual alignment of the text within each row of nutritional data?
Does the nutritional information panel include any visual icons or symbols?
What is the visual style of the '% Daily Value' column—bold, italicized, or regular?
What visual style is used to present the footnote at the bottom of the nutritional facts panel?
